content: With respect to “thinking about if there’s a way to draw/ visualize our thought processes so that they’re easier to share and talk about”. You might find either the Rational Manager (1965) or the New Rational Manager (2013) of interest. Based on the research of Charles Kepner and Benjamin Tregoe, the books outline the fundamental critical thinking processes effective leaders follow to manage their biases when solving problems, making decisions, managing risks, and planning resolution.
